intro: [WRONG START] S-tevia serrata var. ivifolia, commonly known as sweetleaf, is a perennial shrub native to South America. It is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves that are serrated along the edges. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves contain high concentrations of steviol glycosides, which are natural sweeteners. Stevia serrata var. ivifolia is widely cultivated for its use in herbal teas and as a sugar substitute.
